meanings.definition: The quality of being toxic to cells.
meanings.sent1: The cytotoxicity of the chemical was evident in the lab results.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study cytotoxicity to understand how certain substances affect cells.
meanings.sent3: The cytotoxicity of the medicine made the cells run away in fear.
meanings.sent4: The cytotoxicity of the new drug was like a silent assassin attacking the cells.
meanings.sent5: The cytotoxicity of the poison was as deadly as a viper's bite.

meanings.sent1: Researchers are investigating the cytotoxicity of the virus on human cells.
meanings.sent2: Chemotherapy drugs are known for their cytotoxicity against cancer cells.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's power was like cytotoxicity, obliterating any enemy cells in his path.
meanings.sent4: The cytotoxicity of the bleach was so strong that it dissolved the cells instantly.
meanings.sent5: The cytotoxicity of the herbicide was like a wrecking ball demolishing cells.

meanings.definition: The state of being harmful to cells.
meanings.sent1: The cytotoxicity of the radiation caused damage to the cells.
meanings.sent2: Exposure to certain chemicals can increase cytotoxicity in the body.
meanings.sent3: The cytotoxicity of the sun's rays made the cells put on tiny sunglasses.
meanings.sent4: The cytotoxicity of stress was like a storm wreaking havoc on the cells.
meanings.sent5: The cytotoxicity of the toxin was a silent threat lurking within the cells.
